alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 5:59AM EST until January 17 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Oconee...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Moderate flooding continues. Portions of the Old Balls Ferry Road leading to the boat ramp becomes flooded with a foot of water or more. The entire dirt parking lot near the boat ramp is under three to five feet of water. Extensive flooding of the woodlands near the river continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EST Saturday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.1 feet on 09/30/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EST.
